member.name: T:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetLatestConfiguration operation. Retrieves the latest deployed configuration. This API may return empty Configuration data if the client already has the latest version. See StartConfigurationSession to obtain an InitialConfigurationToken to call this API.
Each call to GetLatestConfiguration returns a new ConfigurationToken (NextPollConfigurationToken in the response). This new token MUST be provided to the next call to GetLatestConfiguration when polling for configuration updates.
To avoid excess charges, we recommend that you include the ClientConfigurationVersion value with every call to GetConfiguration. This value must be saved on your client. Subsequent calls to GetConfiguration must pass this value by using the ClientConfigurationVersion parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationRequest.ConfigurationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationToken.
Token describing the current state of the configuration session. To obtain a token, first call the StartConfigurationSession API. Note that every call to GetLatestConfiguration will return a new ConfigurationToken (NextPollConfigurationToken in the response) and MUST be provided to subsequent GetLatestConfiguration API calls.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationResponse
member.summary: Response parameters for the GetLatestConfiguration API

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationResponse.Configuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Configuration.
The data of the configuration. Note that this may be empty if the client already has the latest version of configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationResponse.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
A standard MIME type describing the format of the configuration content.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationResponse.NextPollConfigurationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextPollConfigurationToken.
The latest token describing the current state of the configuration session. This MUST be provided to the next call to GetLatestConfiguration.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationResponse.NextPollIntervalInSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextPollIntervalInSeconds.
The amount of time the client should wait before polling for configuration updates again. See RequiredMinimumPollIntervalInSeconds to set the desired poll interval.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.StartConfigurationSessionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartConfigurationSession operation. Starts a configuration session used to retrieve a deployed configuration. See the GetLatestConfiguration API for more details.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.StartConfigurationSessionRequest.ApplicationIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApplicationIdentifier.
The application ID or the application name.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.StartConfigurationSessionRequest.ConfigurationProfileIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationProfileIdentifier.
The configuration profile ID or the configuration profile name.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.StartConfigurationSessionRequest.EnvironmentIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentIdentifier.
The environment ID or the environment name.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.StartConfigurationSessionRequest.RequiredMinimumPollIntervalInSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequiredMinimumPollIntervalInSeconds.
The interval at which your client will poll for configuration. If provided, the service will throw a BadRequestException if the client polls before the specified poll interval. By default, client poll intervals are not enforced.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.StartConfigurationSessionResponse
member.summary: Response parameters for the StartConfigurationSession API.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.StartConfigurationSessionResponse.InitialConfigurationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InitialConfigurationToken.
Token encapsulating state about the configuration session. Provide this token to the GetLatestConfiguration API to retrieve configuration data.
This token should only be used once in your first call to GetLatestConfiguration. You MUST use the new token in the GetConfiguration response (NextPollConfigurationToken) in each subsequent call to GetLatestConfiguration.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing AppConfigData
Use the AppConfigData API, a capability of AWS AppConfig, to retrieve deployed configuration.

member.name: M:Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAppConfigDataClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAppConfigDataClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataClient.#ctor(Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAppConfigDataClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The AmazonAppConfigDataClient Configuration Object

member.name: M:Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataClient.#ctor(Amazon.Runtime.AWSCredentials)
member.summary: Constructs AmazonAppConfigDataClient with AWS Credentials
member.param: AWS Credentials

member.name: M:Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataClient.GetLatestConfiguration(Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieves the latest deployed configuration. This API may return empty Configuration data if the client already has the latest version. See StartConfigurationSession to obtain an InitialConfigurationToken to call this API.
Each call to GetLatestConfiguration returns a new ConfigurationToken (NextPollConfigurationToken in the response). This new token MUST be provided to the next call to GetLatestConfiguration when polling for configuration updates.
To avoid excess charges, we recommend that you include the ClientConfigurationVersion value with every call to GetConfiguration. This value must be saved on your client. Subsequent calls to GetConfiguration must pass this value by using the ClientConfigurationVersion parameter.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetLatestConfiguration service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetLatestConfiguration service method, as returned by AppConfigData.
member.exception: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by the service.
There was an internal failure in the service.
The requested resource could not be found.
The request was denied due to request throttling.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetLatestConfiguration Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataClient.BeginGetLatestConfiguration(Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationRequest,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the GetLatestConfiguration operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetLatestConfiguration operation on AmazonAppConfigDataClient.
An AsyncCallback delegate that is invoked when the operation completes.
A user-defined state object that is passed to the callback procedure. Retrieve this object from within the callback procedure using the AsyncState property.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that can be used to poll or wait for results, or both; this value is also needed when invoking EndGetLatestConfiguration operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetLatestConfiguration Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataClient.EndGetLatestConfiguration(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Finishes the asynchronous execution of the GetLatestConfiguration operation.
member.param: The IAsyncResult returned by the call to BeginGetLatestConfiguration.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetLatestConfiguration Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AppConfigData.AmazonAppConfigDataClient.StartConfigurationSession(Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.StartConfigurationSessionRequest)

member.name: T:Amazon.AppConfigData.IAmazonAppConfigData
member.summary:
Interface for accessing AppConfigData
Use the AppConfigData API, a capability of AWS AppConfig, to retrieve deployed configuration.

member.name: M:Amazon.AppConfigData.IAmazonAppConfigData.GetLatestConfiguration(Amazon.AppConfigData.Model.GetLatestConfigurationRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieves the latest deployed configuration. This API may return empty Configuration data if the client already has the latest version. See StartConfigurationSession to obtain an InitialConfigurationToken to call this API.
Each call to GetLatestConfiguration returns a new ConfigurationToken (NextPollConfigurationToken in the response). This new token MUST be provided to the next call to GetLatestConfiguration when polling for configuration updates.
To avoid excess charges, we recommend that you include the ClientConfigurationVersion value with every call to GetConfiguration. This value must be saved on your client. Subsequent calls to GetConfiguration must pass this value by using the ClientConfigurationVersion parameter.
